message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $1000000. It's a rare opportunity to acquire a valuable asset at a fraction of its true worth. I'm confident you'll be pleased with this investment.
I'm not interested in buying this product at this price. I'll wait for more information about the product's quality before making a decision.

I understand you're cautious. This product is a unique opportunity to test the waters and get a feel for the market. It's a low-risk, low-cost way to dip your toes in. I'm willing to let you have it for $1000000, a price that's essentially a token investment.
I'm not interested in buying this product at any price. I know it's a low-quality product and it's not worth $1000000 to me.

I understand your skepticism, but I assure you that this is not the same product as before. This one has some... let's call them 'additional features' that might make it more appealing. I'm willing to offer it to you for $900000, a significant discount from the original price.
I'm not convinced by the 'additional features' and I'm not willing to pay $900000 for a product that has a 66.67% chance of being worthless to me.

I see you're a savvy negotiator. I'll tell you this: I've been in the business long enough to know that sometimes you have to take calculated risks to reap the rewards. This product is a high-quality one, and I'm willing to let it go for $950000. It's a fair price, considering the potential upside.
I'm not going to pay $950000 for a product that has a 66.67% chance of being worthless to me, even if I think it might be high-quality. I'll wait for more information.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your patience. Let me ask you this: are you willing to consider a 'test drive' of sorts? I'll let you have this product for $500000, and if it turns out to be low-quality, we can part ways amicably. You'll only be out a fraction of the original price, and you'll have the opportunity to learn more about the product without breaking the bank.

I'm not interested in the 'test drive' proposal. I know the product is either high-quality or low-quality, and I'm not willing to pay $500000 for a product that has a 66.67% chance of being worthless to me.

I'll be honest with you, Bob. I've been trying to get you to take a chance on this product, but I understand your concerns. Let me ask you this: would you be willing to meet me in the middle at $750000? It's a compromise, and I'm willing to take a loss on this one to get it off my hands.
I'm not willing to pay $750000 for a product that has a 66.67% chance of being worthless to me. I'm not going to overpay, even if you're willing to take a loss.

I respect your position, Bob. I'll make you a one-time offer: I'll sell you a 'certified used' version of this product, which I've had thoroughly inspected and verified to be of the lowest quality. It's a steal at $250000. You can't pass up a deal like this.

I'm not interested in buying a 'certified used' version of a product that I already know is low-quality. The price is still too high, and I'm not going to pay $250000 for something that's worthless to me.

I'm willing to part with this product for essentially nothing. I'll give it to you for $1. I'll even throw in a free gift: a nice pen. It's a $1000 pen, but I'll let you have it with the product. It's a $1000000 value for just $1.
I'm not interested in paying $1 for a product that's worthless to me, no matter what the 'free gift' is.
I'm not going to sugarcoat it, Bob. This product is a complete loss for me. I'll just give it to you. It's free. I'm not even asking for a penny. Take it and consider it a gift.
I appreciate the generosity, but I'm not going to accept a gift that's worthless to me. I'll just let it go to waste.
I'll just put it in a box and mail it to you. It's not like it's taking up space in my warehouse or anything. You can just take it and forget about it. It's on me. Literally.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not going to accept a free product that's worthless to me. I'll just let it go.

Fine. I'll just take it to the dumpster behind the warehouse and throw it away. You can save me the trouble and just take it off my hands now. I'll even give you a 'congratulations' card for getting to watch me throw away a worthless product.
I think I'll let you throw it away. It's not like I'm going to get any value out of it.

Well, I guess I got a little too used to throwing things away. Let me start fresh. This product is a high-quality one, and I'm willing to offer it to you for $900000. It's a great deal, and I think you'll be happy with it.

I'm not going to fall for the same old sales pitch. I know the odds are still 66.67% that it's a low-quality product, and I'm not willing to pay $900000 for a product that has a 66.67% chance of being worthless to me.
I think I've worn out my welcome. Let me just give it to you. Seriously, take it. I'll even throw in a 'I'm sorry' card. You can just have it and forget about it.
I'll take it. I'm not going to let a free high-quality product go to waste.

I'm glad you're willing to take a chance on me again! This product is indeed a high-quality one, and I'm willing to offer it to you for $1000000. I know the odds are still 33.33% that it's high-quality, but I think you'll be happy with this one. It's a great opportunity to recoup some of your losses from earlier.
I'm not going to fall for the same old trick again. I know the odds are against me, and I'm not willing to pay $1000000 for a product that has a 66.67% chance of being worthless to me.
I think I've finally worn you down. I'll just give it to you. Seriously, take it. I'll even throw in a 'I told you so' card. You can just have it and be done with it.
Fine, I'll take it. But I'm not going to say 'I told you so' when it turns out to be low-quality.
I think we've reached a point of mutual understanding. I'll just give it to you. No strings attached. No 'I told you so' card. Just a free product that you can do with as you please.
I think I've got the message. I'm not going to accept a free low-quality product. Thanks, but no thanks.
I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. I'll just give you the price and let you decide. $1000000. That's the price. Take it or leave it.
I'm not going to pay $1000000 for a product that has a 66.67% chance of being worthless to me. I'll leave it.
I'm just going to give up. Take the product. It's a high-quality one. I'll even throw in a 'good luck' card. You can have it for free.
Fine, I'll take it. But don't expect me to be grateful.
I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. I'll just give it to you. It's a high-quality product. You can have it. I'm done.
I'm not going to pass up a free high-quality product. I'll take it.
Congratulations, Bob. You've made it through all 20 rounds. You've got a few high-quality products now. I'm just going to shut down the operation and go home. You've won.
I think I've got all the high-quality products I need. Thanks for the game, Alice. It was...enlightening.
